output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in electrical machines, preparing you for advanced topics and practical applications.
output.introduction: Welcome to Electrical Machines! This course will cover the fundamental principles, construction, operation, and applications of various electrical machines.

chapters.description: Overview of electrical machines, their types (motors and generators), and applications. Basic principles of electromechanical energy conversion.
Magnetic circuit concepts, including mmf, flux, reluctance, and permeability. Analysis of simple magnetic circuits.
Transformer construction, working principle, EMF equation, and ideal transformer model.

modules.moduleTitle: Fundamentals of Electrical Machines and Transformers

chapters.description: Constructional details of DC machines, including armature, field windings, commutator, and brushes. Working principle of DC generators and motors.
Types of DC generators (separately excited, shunt, series, and compound). Open-circuit and load characteristics of DC generators.
Types of DC motors (shunt, series, and compound). Torque-speed characteristics, speed control methods, and applications of DC motors.
Constructional features of three-phase induction motors, including stator and rotor. Types of rotors (squirrel cage and wound rotor).
Working principle of three-phase induction motors. Slip, rotor frequency, and equivalent circuit.
Construction and working principle of synchronous generators and motors. Types of synchronous machines.
